CGHS Distance Learning
Based on directives from local and state officials, and to make sure we are keeping our students and community safe, Common Ground High School classes and children's programs will not meet on site until at least May 20.

a.title: Search

div.h3: We are here for our high school students & families in the midst of the COVID-19 epidemic. Distance learning starts Wednesday 3/25. Visit our high school home page for more information.

a.class: fusion-button button-flat fusion-button-round button-large button-default button-2
fusion-button button-flat fusion-button-round button-large button-default button-3

div.h3: Learn about programs for children, families, and adults.

ul.li: Greater than 90% graduation and college acceptance rates

div.h2: Common Ground is a Safe Space.

a.class: fusion-button button-flat fusion-button-round button-large button-default button-4
fusion-button button-flat fusion-button-round button-large button-default button-5
a.span: We stand with the LGBTQ Community

div.class: post-16 page type-page status-publish hentry odd

a.class: fusion-button button-flat fusion-button-round button-large button-custom button-6

div.p: Based on directives from local and state officials, and to make sure we are keeping our students and community safe, Common Ground High School classes and children’s programs will not meet on site until at least May 20.
Common Ground High School is moving ahead with distance learning. Click here for the latest information on distance learning and supports for students and families.

a.class: fusion-button button-flat fusion-button-round button-large button-custom button-7
a.span: Common Ground is Seeking a High School Director

div.p: Common Ground High School in New Haven, CT is looking for our next School Director starting in July, 2020: A dynamic, proven school leader who shares our roots-deep commitment to help all students grow into their full potential — blazing pathways to college success and continuous learning, meaningful careers, whole and healthy lives, their individual passions, and powerful leadership for a just and sustainable world.

a.class: fusion-button button-flat fusion-button-round button-large button-default button-8
fusion-button button-flat fusion-button-round button-large button-custom button-9

div.p: Summer Camp Registration is now OPEN! Spots fill up quickly so click the link below to learn more and get registered!

a.class: fusion-button button-flat fusion-button-round button-large button-default button-10
fusion-button button-flat fusion-button-round button-large button-custom button-11
a.span: Rock to Rock Earth Day Ride

div.p: Join us April 25th for the 12th Annual Rock to Rock Earth Day Ride. Show your love for Common Ground by joining our team or making a donation!

a.class: fusion-button button-flat fusion-button-round button-large button-default button-12

h2.a: Teaching Our Cities, Teaching Our Schoolyards: Seeking Applications from Urban K-12 Public Schools

div.p: Teaching Our Cities & The Schoolyards Program -- programs of Common Ground -- are seeking applications from schools interested in joining in a year-long effort to co-create new, engaging learning experiences for students. Teams from

article.class: fusion-post-grid post-22922 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-board-of-directors odd

h2.a: Draft- Common Ground Board of Directors Minutes- March 2020

div.p: New Haven Ecology Project Board Meeting Minutes March 23rd (Conducted online by Zoom Meeting) Board Members Present: Kyeen Andersson, Wendy Battles, Michael Doolittle, Monica Maccera Filppu, Beth Klingher, Charlie Negaro, Bob Parker, Babz Rawls-Ivy, Errol

article.class: fusion-post-grid post-22846 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-community-programs-2 category-food-policy category-high-school category-uncategorized category-urban-farm even

h2.a: Common Ground’s Inspiring Response to Covid-19

div.p: By: Audrey Nefores, Development Manager for Supporter Engagement Common Ground Student enjoying our East Asian and Chinese solidarity cafeteria lunch! Staff at Common Ground began responding to COVID-19 and its impact on the

Common Ground is a center for learning and leadership, inviting people across ages and identities to connect to their urban environment, build community, grow into their full potential and contribute to a just and sustainable world.

section.h4: You are always welcome at Common Ground.

section.class: widget-2 widget-even widget-alt fusion-footer-widget-column widget widget_search
